content: Hi, I came here to find a quick link for the seminar today? Do we have a place for this? I will find it in the end, but it would be good to have on place with all seminars and the zoom link ...
On the left, under streams and topics I only see OWLS, but no link to all the other events ...
There's also a stream #ACT@UCR seminar which might be what you're after. Link is there, discussion will be there as well.

To answer your immediate question, @Alexander Kurz:

My seminar will start today 10 am in California or 1 pm on the east coast of the United States, or 6 pm in England. It will be held online via Zoom, here:

https://ucr.zoom.us/j/607160601

We will have discussions online here in the comment "April 1st: John Baez". We'll start about 15 or 20 minutes before the talk, with coffee and delicious cookies.

People here are struggling to create a usable calendar that's easy to find. I'm not sure why it's so hard. I thought with all these computer people around, someone would know how to make a calendar. (I'm a mathematician, I deal in timeless truths so I don't know how to make a public calendar.)
Screen-Shot-2020-04-01-at-8.23.30-AM.png Ah -- maybe this was the question. In the second level of the stream, several of the topics don't appear unless you click "more topics"

John Baez said:

(I'm a mathematician, I deal in timeless truths so I don't know how to make a public calendar.)

https://johncarlosbaez.wordpress.com/2020/02/27/topos-theory-part-8/
Hah... "a calendar is just a presheaf of events on the category of days, what's the problem"
I came to learn about open dynamical systems and now I run the calendar.
